newsitem.title: UK: Russian oil major ups stake in Dana field.
newsitem.headline: Russian oil major ups stake in Dana field.

text.p: YUKOS, Russia's second largest oil company, has increased its stake in the West Siberian Sortymskoye field development from 20 to 30 percent, its partner Dana Petroleum said in a statement on Tuesday.
Irish-based oil company Dana has a 30 percent stake in the project. The remaining 40 percent is held by three other firms, including Tyumen Oil, Russia's fourth largest oil company.
YUKOS paid its Russian partners an undisclosed sum to raise its stake from 20 percent, the statement said.

"With YUKOS increasing its shareholding in our field, and becoming the leader of the Russian participants, we will benefit from lower operating costs and a more efficient path for our oil exports," Dana said.
Production from Sortymskoye, Dana's second oil project in West Siberia, is expected to begin by the year-end.
The two wells tied into the pipeline on the Sortymskoye field have tested at 1,100 and 450 barrels per day of medium gravity crude.
